website_summaries.verdict: Bright enough for a midsize room and light enough to carry easily, the BenQ MW705 projector will be of particular interest to anyone who wants to take advantage of its hidden compartment for a wireless streaming module.
pros: Light enough to carry with you
Near-excellent image quality for data images
Hidden compartment for wireless streaming module
cons: With data images, some colors are a little dark
Shows rainbow artifacts with full-motion video

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small church w/ windows.
customer_reviews.text: Our small church purchased this as an upgrade to a 12ish year old projector that finally broke down. This was well worth the investment. Our church has windows all around, there's no escaping the outdoor lighting during our Sunday morning service but this projector had no issue projecting a crisp, clear image w/ hardly any color loss. Super easy to set-up. Perfect for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Bevin

customer_reviews.title: I have no clue how it looks so good on such a crap surface
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for outside movies and eventually basement theatre. I was so excited to try it out I set it up at dusk outside projecting on my dark green siding and I am blown away by the quality. I have no clue how it looks so good on such a crap surface. I'm sure it will be amazing in a dark basement on an actual screen
customer_reviews.author: ryan foster

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright Projector!!
customer_reviews.text: This Projector is a major step up from my old ones!! Lumens make a HUGE difference. My old VVME was only 1500 lumens, and the BenQ is 4000. Color was vivid, and bright from a long throw projection. I saw all the reviews about the bulb issues, i hope I don't have the same problem, other then that I'm a happy camper. I will be buying another one soon. I'm glad I did my homework in what separates all these projectors apart from one another
customer_reviews.author: Marcus R.

customer_reviews.title: Requires a slightly darker room than your standard living room ...
customer_reviews.text: Requires a slightly darker room than your standard living room so make sure you have proper lighting control. Otherwise a very solid projector for both movies and general viewing. Didn't see much motion blur or streaking even on a 120" screen!
customer_reviews.author: Wired Installations LLC

customer_reviews.title: this one works well and it's easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: We are using this projector at the church. We have a lot of windows with natural light coming in, so it's not a ideal place to use projector. However, this one works well and it's easy to set up and use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnyman

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device and does exactly what it says. It delivers better than expected performance. Very good purchase especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The projector I purchased will be primarily used for monogram projection for my DJ Entertainment company. This projector cane highly recommended. So far it has been a great purchase. I plan on purchasing an even more powerful projector sometime in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Grant

customer_reviews.title: The projector seems very nice it worked well expect for during dark images
customer_reviews.text: The projector seems very nice it worked well expect for during dark images, there is a white imperfection. I couldn't figure out what it was until I focused and it appears to be a piece of lint inside the lens. See pictures below. I sent it back and i am waiting for a refund. Hopefully i just received a defecting model. The reviews on it are great and i had success projecting it on a 120" screen. it was easy to set up. We mounted it to the ceiling. We have a dedicated theater room we are finishing and the image looks pretty good except for that imperfection. I will update the rating once I receive a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Staff

customer_reviews.title: Great overhead projector with good light output
customer_reviews.text: Great overhead projector with good light output. I can run powerpoint presentations in a very well lit large room without dimming or turning the lights off. DVDs need the lights dimmed or turned off for best picture. Bought this one "refurbished" and saved over $100 and it's just like new. Highly recommend this. When my old Infocus SP4805 finally bites the dust at home, I'm replacing it with another BenQ MW705.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Projector
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, i havent had any issues with this projector. Sound is a bit low so i bought an amplifier and sterio speakers. So far i think this is a great projector
customer_reviews.author: Resilient

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this Projector! images are sharp and bright! vids are brilliant! awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Vencot D.

customer_reviews.title: Great picture!
customer_reviews.text: Very clear picture even with VGA connection. Love the landscape proportions!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: BenQ MW705 4,000 ANSI Lumen 3D DLP Projector
product_meta.description: MW705 Digital Projector features new keypad for easy operation, MHL mirroring the screen of smart devices, 13000:1 contrast ratio with 4000 ANSI lumens brightness, 2D Keystone, HDMI / MHL Port and optional wireless display
feature_bullets: Powerfully bright 4000 ANSI Lumens and whisper quiet 31dB
Wireless presentation via your smart device by QCast (optional)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars19 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
